bibl.author: Hannah Whitman Heyde
bibl.title: Hannah Whitman Heyde to Walt Whitman, 17 August [1873]
bibl.orgName: Hannah Louisa Whitman Heyde Papers, 1853–1892, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

revisionDesc.change: made basic checking changes to file

body.p: I am so much afraid you have been worried about me
I hope not—for I care as much about your health as my own

Your letter did me good. dear Brother you are so kind to speak of coming to see me. I am down stairs, am feeling much better, more so than at any time I have had such good care. Charlie has been so kind. dear dear brothebrother thanks for all your letters take good care of yourself
that will do me more good than you think
I am sorry about your lameness. I think about you always.
I shall get well as ever I think in time. HWH is Eoloy

closer.salute: I send ever & ever so much love to you my dear brother and to all
